alert.note: Alert for Macomb; Oakland; St. Clair; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Gusty winds preceding and within approaching thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Wayne, southeastern Oakland, Macomb and central St. Clair Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 411 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty winds ahead of an area of thunderstorms. This line extends from near Memphis to near Macomb Township to near Livonia. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph are possible along this gust front and within any trailing thunderstorms that move across the area. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Gusty winds will be near... Romeo, Sterling Heights, Clinton, Armada and Macomb Township around 415 PM EDT. Mount Clemens, Richmond and Emmett around 420 PM EDT. Memphis around 425 PM EDT. Southfield around 435 PM EDT. Royal Oak and Detroit Zoo around 440 PM EDT. New Baltimore and Dearborn around 445 PM EDT. Warren and Detroit around 450 PM EDT. Downtown Detroit around 455 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Anchorville, Franklin, Shelby Township, Ray Center, Utica, Fort Gratiot, Harper Woods, Pleasant Ridge, Westland and Grosse Pointe Shores. People attending Buy Michigan Now Festival, Dearborn Homecoming Festival, and Freedom Hill Amphitheatre should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
